ygData.subject: Re: zoning
ygData.msgSnippet: It s not the connection that affects zoning.  I ve hopped on after hours at work sometimes where we run off cable modems and then gone home to my 56k and found
ygData.messageBody:
It's not the connection that affects zoning. I've hopped on after hours at
work sometimes where we run off cable modems and then gone home to my 56k
and found no difference in the loading speed.

Lary, William wrote:

> From: "Lary, William" <WLary@...>
>
> Hiya
> i have a amd 400mhz 64mb of ps100 ram 16mb video card-banshee
> and an awesome creative 128bit sound card. however i have NEVER zoned in
> less than a minute, usually more, i know a lot of it is processor
> i have hit zones withgroups and i am the last one to wake up so to speak
> the others had p2 350mhz etc i do have a 33.6 modem so i think it is
> the modem connection that makes the biggest difference, i wish my work
> computer had a cd rom drive installed, its just a p266 with 80mb but the
> 45kps T1 connection would surely be nice as opposed to my
> 3.5 to about 4.0kps i get with my 33.6 modem. does anyone out there
> play on a recommended p200 or above system req and use a T1?
> i wold love to know the zone times ya get:)
> Doublestar
>
